title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview is usually virtual with a panel of 3+ leadership. The interviewers are personable and try to make the interview not stressful. Interview questions are typical behavioral questions... very straightforward.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time a patient/family was dissatisfied with your care. how did you handle it

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Ysidro Health
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward interview with three nursing supervisors. Part conversational; part standard interview questions. Impressed with the ease of the interview -gave me a chance to get a good feel for the organization.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Special Events Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Ysidro Health
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were distracted and unprofessional. They kept making jokes during the interview and I did not feel like my time was being respected. It made me feel very uncomfortable on top of the already stressful situation that an interview poses.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Smooth process, one will receive an immediate call from the HR to set you up for the interview. HR recruiter will inform you of the next steps in the hiring process. The communication between you and HR is great.
Interview Questions: Where do you see your self in 5 years.

title: System Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had multiple interviews. First, with the IT Director, then a group interview with the IT Director and Manager, and finally with HR. All interviews helped both sides learn more about one another to see if it was a good fit.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Nurse Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Ysidro Health
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview over Zoom, met with who would be my supervisor and was asked a series of question and situation-based scenarios. Asked about my education/work history and typical interview questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about your strengths

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very accommodating   , welcoming environment . They welcoming you will be l at ease . Questions are practical and personal . Very nice employees . Most personnel are nurses that conducted interview . Very polite but straight .
Interview Questions: What you will be 5 years from now

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Talent Software Service Inc reached out to me on September. Scheduled an interview with the San Ysidro Health's hiring manager and a potential co worker on October. Process took 1 week. Got ghosted by the recruiter after the interview.
Interview Questions: Behavorial question and some SQL coding problem

title: Medical Scribe Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at San Ysidro Health
Interview Descriptions: Casual. Ask questions about experience  and. Biggest thing  is typing. Test and availability. Very causal conversation with the girl interviewing. Better because she was young and premed before so understands
Interview Questions: Typing test

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions:
For my role it was Very structured panel interview. 
I had a phone a screening, 1:1 interview and a panel interview. Don’t be intimidated by the panel if you are confident and know your role you will be fine.
Interview Questions: What do you know about our organization?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a very long wait to actually interview. I showed up to my interview in the afternoon 10 min ahead of time to be early. I ended up waiting a full hour and thought about leaving. The first interview was a panel interview with 3 people. Throughout the interview the managers radio would go off or they would page him overhead. It was very difficult to concentrate on interviewing. After this interview I was invited for a 2nd panel interview and then received my offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a difficult patient and how you handled it

title: Patient Acess Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health (Chula Vista, CA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was conducted before COVID. Now they have transitioned into virtual interviews.
1. Phone Screener - 15-20 minute phone call with a recruiter. 
2. In-person interview with a supervisor. 
3. In-person interview with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself in the workplace and how does it reflect to the position you're applying to?

title: General Dentist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very casual and to the point. Group interview setting. Very upfront and honest. No games. Discussion of benefits of working in community health and type of dentistry being practiced. Discussion of differences between community health and private practice.
Interview Questions: What procedures are you comfortable with in dentistry?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, in person interview with the DON (includes typing test & writing a paragraph about a certain topic), shadowing another nurse/interview. The meeting with the DON she explained the expectation, it was a sheet of paper that included: short nails, clean shoes, no tattoos showing or piercings. questions asked were referencing if I had any children.
Interview Questions: tell me a time where you did not get along with a co-worker, and what did you do about it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Began with a phone interview with Human Resources that lasted approx. 20 min
The rest of the interviews were in-person:
First interview: with Lead Nurse and assistant manager, 
Second interview: Nursing Director,
Third Interview: Chief Nurse of San Ysidro Health and shadowed an RN,
Fourth Interview: Shadowed Lead Nurse and answered any remaining questions
Interview Questions:
Why do you wanna work here?
Why San Ysidro Health?
Tell me a time you solved a conflict with a coworker?
How do you triage?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health (San Ysidro, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Sumit your application online and www.syhc.org/careers after 1-2 weeks you will receive a call from HR located at del sol SY they will schedule with you a phone interview where they ask you about your work,educational. and professional experience. If selected to continue with the screening process you will receive a call directly from the program or clinic manager (both are going to interview you) to schedule an in person interview. When arriving for the interview they will give yoyu a tour of the site and explain the different roles of each department. Once the interview is completed they will  walk you to the reception and thank you for your time, as well as a handshake stating that the screening process is still on and that they will inform you if you were selected. If selected, you will be notified 3-7 days later. After that you go on board with HR for your background check and employee physical exam.
Interview Questions: Describe you experience in the geriatric field.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy. The questions were read off of a sheet and were the basic interview questions found online. The recruiter was very serious and straight to the point. Didn’t have a chance to smile because I felt it was unprofessional since I wanted to mirror the recruiter’s vibe.
Interview Questions: Why choose this company?

title: Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
slow and long . Many phone calls and 3 interviews. staff was very nice and helpful . 
Good communication throughot the  hiring process.
I have been told taht the selection oriess has been improved since i got hired
Interview Questions: Years of ecperience i had

title: HIS SPECIALIST Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Everything went pretty fast. I received a call to schedule the interview that week. I waited all of five minutes for the supervisor. We spoke in the admin office for a small amount of time and then I went home.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Contracts Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at San Ysidro Health
Interview Descriptions: Very lengthy interview process. Called back for multiple interviews with different people. They took a long time to make a decision. Offered me a job and then when I negotiated the salary they said they found someone else who would accept the lower salary.
Interview Questions: Mostly pretty standard questions.
